Stella terra is
said to be the world's first off-road vehicle
powered by
solar energy by a design team of students at the University of Technology of the Netherlands.  Tested over 1000
km in
Morocco, the Stella Terra went through many
different places such as dry river bottoms,
jungles, hilly roads and deserts. The two-
seater vehicle uses solar energy
through the roof panels in
one go.  Today it can travel 630 km on
normal roads and about 550 km on
other terrain. We started in the
North of Morocco and drove the car more than 1000 km through
many terrains. Ending the journey
in the Sahara Salera desert.  Traveling
entirely under the sun without having to stop at a
charging station, the design team said
testing the vehicle exceeded
their expectations with only a few
minor adjustments along the way that not
only made the vehicle usable.  The energy is
30 minutes less than the original calculation. It is very
difficult to build an off-road vehicle that is
energy efficient under
normal conditions, so
this invention is considered to be able to change the future
in Vietnam.  Indonesian dancers are trying to
preserve a traditional dance that has existed since
ancient times on the island of Java. An ancient dance
called ler l na is
performed during fertility ceremonies and to
pray for good
harvests.  In front of an audience of thousands of people watching
Ranto and other dancers
gracefully perform, the traditional
lenger lanan lenger lanan is a dance that
describes two people, male and female, meeting each other
in the early days of the Dao people.  In the past,
this dance was performed in
fertility and prosperity rituals, when at that time,
tourists were mainly men, but
now women can also perform
this dance. Lan dance is said to appear in ancient times.
Since the 16th century, Indonesia has
gradually suffered from bad luck,
partly because Muslims considered this tune
inappropriate for use.

Speaker of the US House of Representatives, James Jordan, continued to
fail in the second vote. Mr. Jordan
received 199 votes in support, but
the number of Republican lawmakers opposing him was
higher than in the first vote, 22.
After this vote, Mr. Jordan
announced that he would continue the race for the
Republican candidate. He said he would meet with
lawmakers individually but it was unclear
when he would seek a third vote,
while the Republican candidate
Hakim Jeffrey's Democratic Party once again received
all 212 votes from Allied artists.
However, Mr. Je did not have
enough votes because the Democratic Party has been in the
minority in the House of Representatives for 15 days.  The
US House of Representatives cannot find a
replacement for Mr. Kevin Mcy, the
